title: Calories in 1 Teaspoon Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in olive oil tsp, including full nutrition breakdown, fat content, and healthy fat equivalents for cooking and dieting.
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil; 1 tsp ≈ 5 ml or 4.5 g; pure, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by olive variety, processing, and brand. Density can affect volume-to-weight; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One teaspoon of olive oil provides ~40 kcal, primarily from monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use extra light olive oil instead
Add to salad dressing with vinegar (no calorie change from oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in olive oil tsp?
faqs.a: About 40 kcal per teaspoon of extra virgin olive oil.
Yes, mostly monounsaturated fats support heart health; 4.5 g fat per tsp.

faqs.q: Calories in tablespoon of olive oil?
Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No—0 g carbs, 0 g protein; all calories from fat.

faqs.q: How does olive oil compare to butter per tsp?
faqs.a: Olive oil: 40 kcal, 0.6 g sat fat; butter: ~34 kcal, 2.3 g sat fat.
